questions.question: What is Macbeth's lie to Banquo about the witches' predictions?

choices.answer: He says he does not remember what they said
He says he does not even think about them
He says they made a lucky guess on their predictions
He says only fools and women believe such nonsense

questions.question: Why is Banquo awake so late at night in Scene 1?

choices.answer: The strange darkness disturbs him.
The owl hoots and cries out to him.
The sound of the clock keeps waking him.
His restless thoughts keep him awake.

questions.question: What is Lady Macbeth's signal to Macbeth to let him know that she has taken care of the guards?

choices.answer: She will ring a bell
She will send a servant to say she is ill
She will light three candles
She will whistle like a bird

questions.question: What excuse does Lady Macbeth give for not killing the king herself?

choices.answer: It would make Macbeth feel weak
She is not strong enough
She had a vision of Macbeth killing Duncan
Duncan reminded her of her own father

questions.question: When Macbeth is unable to say "Amen," what is Lady Macbeth's advice?

choices.answer: He should keep trying until he succeeds
It does not matter whether he can say it
They shouldn't think about it or it will make them crazy
After things calm down, he can see a priest for forgiveness

questions.question: Macbeth worries that a voice says, "Macbeth doth murder sleep." What is Lady Macbeth's advice?

choices.answer: Have a glass of wine and relax
Get cleaned up and forget about it
Have a minstrel come sing a lullaby to put them to sleep
Go for a walk in the garden for fresh air

questions.question: Why won't Macbeth return the daggers to the crime scene?

choices.answer: He can't bear to look at Duncan again
He is afraid to be seen and look suspicious
He thinks it is bad luck to touch them
He says he has done enough and Lady Macbeth must do her part
A servant at Macbeth's chamber
Macduff and Lennox at the gate
A drunkard wanting a place to sleep
A messenger with a note for Lady Macbeth

questions.question: What three things does drink provoke?

choices.answer: Sin, ill-tempers, and ruin
Poor health, nightmares, and poverty
Nose-painting, sleep, and urine
Fighting, hatred, and trouble

questions.question: How does Lennox describe the night?

choices.answer: It was a terrible night that predicts confusing times ahead.
It was a peaceful and beautiful night
It was an awful night because of the witches.
It was an ordinary night and he is unaware of chaos
A note detailing the plot to kill Duncan
An unlocked gate and a drunk porter
Another omen--dead flowers in the garden
Duncan's dead body

questions.question: What is ironic about Macduff refusing to tell Lady Macbeth about Duncan's death?

choices.answer: He pretended to be brave but wasn't
He sounded concerned but thinks she is weal and foolish
He tried to sound upset but was glad of Duncan's death
He didn't know about Lady Macbeth's part in the murder

questions.question: What excuse did Macbeth give for killing the guards?

choices.answer: He was drunk and iddn't realize what he had done
He did it out of pain and rage
It was self defense
The witches made him do it

questions.question: Why do Malcolm and Donalbain leave?

choices.answer: They don't want to be accused of the crime
They are going to take the news to their mother
They are afraid for their lives
They need to make funeral arrangements

questions.question: Why does Ross refuse to believe Malcom and Donalbain killed their own father?

choices.answer: He was with them and knows they are innocent
It was against their personal natures
They are not ambitious enough to be king
They do not have the strength to commit such an act
